Class minimud.Controller 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Thread
           |
           +----minimud.Controller
public class Controller
extends Thread
The overall controller for the Minimud.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tristan Greaves

mud_objects
The list of objects in the MUD, filled with mudobjects
players_list
The list of players in the MUD, filled with Player objects.
queue
Queue of MUD messages.

Controller()
Constructor.

AddToQueue(Object)
Adds a single object to the Minimud Events Queue
dealInput(Player, String)
When a player has connected, future input ends up being dealt with by this routine.
getmud_objects()
Returns the list of objects in the MUD
getPlayers()
Returns the list of players in the MUD
newPlayer(queue_user)
Registers a new player with the MUD, creating an instance for him/her.
removePlayer(Player)
Removes a player from the players list
run()
Processes the entire queue whenever it is awoken.
sendtoAll(String)
Sends a message to all the players on the MUD It sends a newline character first in order to interrupt what a player may already be typing.
sendtoAll_inroom(Player, String)
Sends a message to all those that are in Player p's room, except for the player mentioned.
sendtoAll_noCR(Player, String)
Sends a message to all the players on the MUD, as with sendtoAll.

queue 
 protected Vector queue
Queue of MUD messages. Things such as players issuing around are stored in this queue, and picked up by the Controller which deals with them.

players_list 
 protected Vector players_list
The list of players in the MUD, filled with Player objects.

mud_objects 
 protected Vector mud_objects
The list of objects in the MUD, filled with mudobjects

Controller 
 public Controller()
Constructor. Initialises event queue and players_list vectors. Also reads in and initialises MUD objects list.

AddToQueue 
 public void AddToQueue(Object obj)
Adds a single object to the Minimud Events Queue

Parameters:
obj - The object to add, typically a queueItem
getPlayers 
 public Vector getPlayers()
Returns the list of players in the MUD

getmud_objects 
 public Vector getmud_objects()
Returns the list of objects in the MUD

removePlayer 
 public void removePlayer(Player p)
Removes a player from the players list

Parameters:
p - Player to be removed.
run 
 public synchronized void run()
Processes the entire queue whenever it is awoken. Calls external functions when required.

Overrides:
run in class Thread
newPlayer 
 public void newPlayer(queue_user qu)
Registers a new player with the MUD, creating an instance for him/her. Also sends introduction screen and prompts for a character name.

Parameters:
qu - User's queue structure
dealInput 
 public void dealInput(Player p,
                       String s)
When a player has connected, future input ends up being dealt with by this routine.

Parameters:
p - Player
s - String containing what they typed
sendtoAll 
 public void sendtoAll(String s)
Sends a message to all the players on the MUD It sends a newline character first in order to interrupt what a player may already be typing. Note that this will cause an extra gap to be displayed on whoever caused the message to be sent.

Parameters:
s - String to send.
sendtoAll_noCR 
 public void sendtoAll_noCR(Player p,
                            String s)
Sends a message to all the players on the MUD, as with sendtoAll. However, no extra CR is sent to the nominated player.

Parameters:
p - Player to who an extra CR should not be sent.
s - String to send.
sendtoAll_inroom 
 public void sendtoAll_inroom(Player p,
                              String s)
Sends a message to all those that are in Player p's room, except for the player mentioned.

Parameters:
p - Player to suck room number from, and do not send to this player.
s - String to send.
